service: Amazon Managed Blockchain (AMB) Query provides you with convenient access to multi-blockchain network data, which makes it easier for you to extract contextual data related to blockchain activity. You can use AMB Query to read data from public blockchain networks, such as Bitcoin Mainnet and Ethereum Mainnet. You can also get information such as the current and historical balances of addresses, or you can get a list of blockchain transactions for a given time period. Additionally, you can get details of a given transaction, such as transaction events, which you can further analyze or use in business logic for your applications.

operations.BatchGetTokenBalance:
Gets the token balance for a batch of tokens by using the BatchGetTokenBalance action for every token in the request.

Only the native tokens BTC and ETH, and the ERC-20, ERC-721, and ERC 1155 token standards are supported.
operations.GetAssetContract:
Gets the information about a specific contract deployed on the blockchain.

  • The Bitcoin blockchain networks do not support this operation.

  • Metadata is currently only available for some ERC-20 contracts. Metadata will be available for additional contracts in the future.
operations.GetTokenBalance:
Gets the balance of a specific token, including native tokens, for a given address (wallet or contract) on the blockchain.

Only the native tokens BTC and ETH, and the ERC-20, ERC-721, and ERC 1155 token standards are supported.
operations.GetTransaction:
Gets the details of a transaction.

This action will return transaction details for all transactions that are confirmed on the blockchain, even if they have not reached finality.
operations.ListAssetContracts:
Lists all the contracts for a given contract type deployed by an address (either a contract address or a wallet address).

The Bitcoin blockchain networks do not support this operation.
operations.ListFilteredTransactionEvents:
Lists all the transaction events for an address on the blockchain.

This operation is only supported on the Bitcoin networks.
operations.ListTokenBalances:
This action returns the following for a given blockchain network:

  • Lists all token balances owned by an address (either a contract address or a wallet address).

  • Lists all token balances for all tokens created by a contract.

  • Lists all token balances for a given token.

You must always specify the network property of the tokenFilter when using this operation.
operations.ListTransactionEvents:
Lists all the transaction events for a transaction

This action will return transaction details for all transactions that are confirmed on the blockchain, even if they have not reached finality.
operations.ListTransactions: Lists all the transaction events for a transaction.

AccessDeniedException.base: The Amazon Web Services account doesnâ€™t have access to this resource.

AddressIdentifierFilter.base: This is the container for the unique public address on the blockchain.

refs.ListFilteredTransactionEventsInput$addre: This is the unique public address on the blockchain for which the transaction events are being requested.

refs.AddressIdentifierFilter$transactionEvent: The container for the recipient address of the transaction.

AssetContract.base: This container contains information about an contract.

refs.ListAssetContractsOutput$contracts: An array of contract objects that contain the properties for each contract.

refs.BatchGetTokenBalanceOutput$errors: An array of BatchGetTokenBalanceErrorItem objects returned from the request.

BatchGetTokenBalanceInputItem.base: The container for the input for getting a token balance.

BatchGetTokenBalanceOutputItem.base: The container for the properties of a token balance output.

refs.BatchGetTokenBalanceOutput$tokenBalances: An array of BatchGetTokenBalanceOutputItem objects returned by the response.

refs.Transaction$blockHash: The block hash is a unique identifier for a block. It is a fixed-size string that is calculated by using the information in the block. The block hash is used to verify the integrity of the data in the block.

refs.GetTokenBalanceInput$atBlockchainInstant:
The time for when the TokenBalance is requested or the current time if a time is not provided in the request.

This time will only be recorded up to the second.
refs.TokenBalance$atBlockchainInstant:
The time for when the TokenBalance is requested or the current time if a time is not provided in the request.

This time will only be recorded up to the second.
refs.TokenBalance$lastUpdatedTime: The Timestamp of the last transaction at which the balance for the token in the wallet was updated.

refs.TransactionEvent$voutSpent:
Specifies if the transaction output is spent or unspent. This is only returned for BITCOIN_VOUT event types.

This is only returned for BITCOIN_VOUT event types.
refs.VoutFilter$voutSpent: Specifies if the transaction output is spent or unspent.

refs.ContractIdentifier$contractAddress: Container for the blockchain address about a contract.
refs.GetAssetContractOutput$deployerAddress: The address of the deployer of contract.
refs.ListTransactionsInput$address: The address (either a contract or wallet), whose transactions are being requested.
refs.OwnerIdentifier$address: The contract or wallet address for the owner.
refs.TokenFilter$contractAddress: This is the address of the contract.
refs.Transaction$to: The identifier of the transaction. It is generated whenever a transaction is verified and added to the blockchain.
refs.Transaction$from: The initiator of the transaction. It is either in the form a public key or a contract address.
refs.TransactionEvent$from: The wallet address initiating the transaction. It can either be a public key or a contract.
refs.TransactionEvent$to: The wallet address receiving the transaction. It can either be a public key or a contract.

refs.Transaction$confirmationStatus: Specifies whether the transaction has reached Finality.
refs.TransactionEvent$confirmationStatus: This container specifies whether the transaction has reached Finality.
refs.TransactionOutputItem$confirmationStatus: Specifies whether to list transactions that have not reached Finality.

ConfirmationStatusFilter.base: The container for the ConfirmationStatusFilter that filters for the finality of the results.

refs.ListTransactionsInput$confirmationStatus: This filter is used to include transactions in the response that haven't reached finality . Transactions that have reached finality are always part of the response.

refs.ConfirmationStatusFilter$include: The container to determine whether to list results that have only reached finality . Transactions that have reached finality are always part of the response.

ContractFilter.base: The contract or wallet address by which to filter the request.

refs.ListAssetContractsInput$contractFilter: Contains the filter parameter for the request.

ContractIdentifier.base: Container for the blockchain address and network information about a contract.

refs.AssetContract$contractIdentifier: The container for the contract identifier containing its blockchain network and address.
refs.GetAssetContractInput$contractIdentifier: Contains the blockchain address and network information about the contract.
refs.GetAssetContractOutput$contractIdentifie: Contains the blockchain address and network information about the contract.

refs.Transaction$executionStatus: Identifies whether the transaction has succeeded or failed.

refs.BatchGetTokenBalanceInput$getTokenBalanc: An array of BatchGetTokenBalanceInputItem objects whose balance is being requested.

refs.ContractMetadata$decimals: The decimals used by the token contract.
refs.Transaction$signatureV: The signature of the transaction. The Z coordinate of a point V.
refs.TransactionEvent$voutIndex: The position of the transaction output in the transaction output list.
refs.TransactionEvent$spentVoutIndex:
The position of the spent transaction output in the output list of the creating transaction.

This is only returned for BITCOIN_VIN event types.

InternalServerException.base: The request processing has failed because of an internal error in the service.

refs.ListAssetContractsInput$maxResults:
The maximum number of contracts to list.

Default: 100

Even if additional results can be retrieved, the request can return less results than maxResults or an empty array of results.

To retrieve the next set of results, make another request with the returned nextToken value. The value of nextToken is null when there are no more results to return

refs.ListFilteredTransactionEventsInput$maxRe:
The maximum number of transaction events to list.

Default: 100

Even if additional results can be retrieved, the request can return less results than maxResults or an empty array of results.

To retrieve the next set of results, make another request with the returned nextToken value. The value of nextToken is null when there are no more results to return

ListFilteredTransactionEventsSort.base:
Lists all the transaction events for an address on the blockchain.

This operation is only supported on the Bitcoin blockchain networks.

refs.ListFilteredTransactionEventsInput$sort: The order by which the results will be sorted.

refs.ListFilteredTransactionEventsSort$sortBy: Container on how the results will be sorted by?

refs.ListTokenBalancesInput$maxResults:
The maximum number of token balances to return.

Default: 100

Even if additional results can be retrieved, the request can return less results than maxResults or an empty array of results.

To retrieve the next set of results, make another request with the returned nextToken value. The value of nextToken is null when there are no more results to return

refs.ListTransactionEventsInput$maxResults:
The maximum number of transaction events to list.

Default: 100

Even if additional results can be retrieved, the request can return less results than maxResults or an empty array of results.

To retrieve the next set of results, make another request with the returned nextToken value. The value of nextToken is null when there are no more results to return

refs.ListTransactionsInput$maxResults:
The maximum number of transactions to list.

Default: 100

Even if additional results can be retrieved, the request can return less results than maxResults or an empty array of results.

To retrieve the next set of results, make another request with the returned nextToken value. The value of nextToken is null when there are no more results to return

ListTransactionsSort.base: The container for determining how the list transaction result will be sorted.

refs.ListTransactionsInput$sort: The order by which the results will be sorted.

refs.Transaction$transactionIndex: The index of the transaction within a blockchain.
refs.Transaction$numberOfTransactions: The number of transactions in the block.

refs.ListAssetContractsInput$nextToken: The pagination token that indicates the next set of results to retrieve.
refs.ListAssetContractsOutput$nextToken: The pagination token that indicates the next set of results to retrieve.
refs.ListFilteredTransactionEventsInput$nextT: The pagination token that indicates the next set of results to retrieve.
refs.ListFilteredTransactionEventsOutput$next: The pagination token that indicates the next set of results to retrieve.
refs.ListTokenBalancesInput$nextToken: The pagination token that indicates the next set of results to retrieve.
refs.ListTokenBalancesOutput$nextToken: The pagination token that indicates the next set of results to retrieve.
refs.ListTransactionEventsInput$nextToken: The pagination token that indicates the next set of results to retrieve.
refs.ListTransactionEventsOutput$nextToken: The pagination token that indicates the next set of results to retrieve.
refs.ListTransactionsInput$nextToken: The pagination token that indicates the next set of results to retrieve.
refs.ListTransactionsOutput$nextToken: The pagination token that indicates the next set of results to retrieve.

OwnerFilter.base: The container for the owner information to filter by.

refs.ListTokenBalancesInput$ownerFilter: The contract or wallet address on the blockchain network by which to filter the request. You must specify the address property of the ownerFilter when listing balances of tokens owned by the address.

refs.GetTokenBalanceInput$ownerIdentifier: The container for the identifier for the owner.
refs.TokenBalance$ownerIdentifier: The container for the identifier of the owner.

refs.GetTransactionInput$network: The blockchain network where the transaction occurred.
refs.ListTransactionEventsInput$network: The blockchain network where the transaction events occurred.
refs.ListTransactionsInput$network: The blockchain network where the transactions occurred.
refs.Transaction$network: The blockchain network where the transaction occurred.
refs.TransactionEvent$network: The blockchain network where the transaction occurred.
refs.TransactionOutputItem$network: The blockchain network where the transaction occurred.

refs.TokenIdentifier$tokenId:
The unique identifier of the token.

For native tokens, use the 3 character abbreviation that best matches your token. For example, btc for Bitcoin, eth for Ether, etc. For all other token types you must specify the tokenId in the 64 character hexadecimal tokenid format.
refs.TransactionEvent$tokenId: The unique identifier for the token involved in the transaction.

refs.GetAssetContractOutput$tokenStandard: The token standard of the contract requested.

refs.GetTransactionInput$transactionHash: The hash of a transaction. It is generated when a transaction is created.
refs.ListTransactionEventsInput$transactionHa: The hash of a transaction. It is generated when a transaction is created.
refs.Transaction$transactionHash: The hash of a transaction. It is generated when a transaction is created.
refs.TransactionEvent$transactionHash: The hash of a transaction. It is generated when a transaction is created.
refs.TransactionOutputItem$transactionHash: The hash of a transaction. It is generated when a transaction is created.

refs.GetTransactionInput$transactionId:
The identifier of a Bitcoin transaction. It is generated when a transaction is created.

transactionId is only supported on the Bitcoin networks.
refs.ListTransactionEventsInput$transactionId:
The identifier of a Bitcoin transaction. It is generated when a transaction is created.

transactionId is only supported on the Bitcoin networks.
refs.TransactionOutputItem$transactionId: The identifier of a Bitcoin transaction. It is generated when a transaction is created.

refs.ResourceNotFoundException$resourceId: The resourceId of the resource that caused the exception.
refs.ServiceQuotaExceededException$resourceId: The resourceId of the resource that caused the exception.

refs.ResourceNotFoundException$resourceType: The resourceType of the resource that caused the exception.
refs.ServiceQuotaExceededException$resourceTy: The resourceType of the resource that caused the exception.

ServiceQuotaExceededException.base: The service quota has been exceeded for this resource.

refs.ListFilteredTransactionEventsSort$sortOr: The container for the sort order for ListFilteredTransactionEvents. The SortOrder field only accepts the values ASCENDING and DESCENDING. Not providing SortOrder will default to ASCENDING.
refs.ListTransactionsSort$sortOrder: The container for the sort order for ListTransactions. The SortOrder field only accepts the values ASCENDING and DESCENDING. Not providing SortOrder will default to ASCENDING.

refs.BatchGetTokenBalanceErrorItem$errorCode: The error code associated with the error.
refs.ListFilteredTransactionEventsInput$netwo:
The blockchain network where the transaction occurred.

Valid Values: BITCOIN_MAINNET | BITCOIN_TESTNET
refs.Transaction$blockNumber: The block number in which the transaction is recorded.
refs.Transaction$gasUsed: The amount of gas used for the transaction.
refs.Transaction$cumulativeGasUsed: The amount of gas used up to the specified point in the block.
refs.Transaction$signatureR: The signature of the transaction. The X coordinate of a point R.
refs.Transaction$signatureS: The signature of the transaction. The Y coordinate of a point S.
refs.Transaction$transactionId: The identifier of a Bitcoin transaction. It is generated when a transaction is created.
refs.TransactionEvent$transactionId: The identifier of a Bitcoin transaction. It is generated when a transaction is created.
refs.TransactionEvent$spentVoutTransactionId:
The transactionId that created the spent transaction output.

This is only returned for BITCOIN_VIN event types.
refs.TransactionEvent$spentVoutTransactionHas:
The transactionHash that created the spent transaction output.

This is only returned for BITCOIN_VIN event types.
refs.ValidationExceptionField$name: The name of the field that triggered the ValidationException.

ThrottlingException.base: The request or operation couldn't be performed because a service is throttling requests. The most common source of throttling errors is when you create resources that exceed your service limit for this resource type. Request a limit increase or delete unused resources, if possible.

TimeFilter.base: This container is used to specify a time frame.

refs.ListFilteredTransactionEventsInput$timeF: This container specifies the time frame for the transaction events returned in the response.

refs.BlockchainInstant$time:
The container of the Timestamp of the blockchain instant.

This timestamp will only be recorded up to the second.

refs.ListTokenBalancesOutput$tokenBalances: An array of TokenBalance objects. Each object contains details about the token balance.

TokenFilter.base:
The container of the token filter like the contract address on a given blockchain network or a unique token identifier on a given blockchain network.

You must always specify the network property of this container when using this operation.

refs.ListTokenBalancesInput$tokenFilter:
The contract address or a token identifier on the blockchain network by which to filter the request. You must specify the contractAddress property of this container when listing tokens minted by a contract.

You must always specify the network property of this container when using this operation.

TokenIdentifier.base:
The container for the identifier for the token including the unique token ID and its blockchain network.

Only the native tokens BTC and ETH, and the ERC-20, ERC-721, and ERC 1155 token standards are supported.

refs.GetTokenBalanceInput$tokenIdentifier: The container for the identifier for the token, including the unique token ID and its blockchain network.
refs.TokenBalance$tokenIdentifier: The identifier for the token, including the unique token ID and its blockchain network.

Transaction.base:
There are two possible types of transactions used for this data type:

  • A Bitcoin transaction is a movement of BTC from one address to another.

  • An Ethereum transaction refers to an action initiated by an externally owned account, which is an account managed by a human, not a contract. For example, if Bob sends Alice 1 ETH, Bob's account must be debited and Alice's must be credited. This state-changing action occurs within a transaction.

TransactionEvent.base: The container for the properties of a transaction event.

refs.ListFilteredTransactionEventsOutput$even: The transaction events returned by the request.
refs.ListTransactionEventsOutput$events: An array of TransactionEvent objects. Each object contains details about the transaction events.

refs.ListTransactionsOutput$transactions: The array of transactions returned by the request.

refs.ValidationException$fieldList: The container for the fieldList of the exception.

refs.ValidationException$reason: The container for the reason for the exception

VoutFilter.base: This container specifies filtering attributes related to BITCOIN_VOUT event types

refs.ListFilteredTransactionEventsInput$voutF: This container specifies filtering attributes related to BITCOIN_VOUT event types
